reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Advancing Client-centered Care and Expanding Sustainable Services for TB

description.narrative: Philippines - Tuberculosis - Philippine Business for Social Progress, Inc. - PBSP. This program has the following goals: Reduce TB burden by decreasing the number of TB deaths by 50% from 14,000 to 7,000 by 2022. Reduce TB burden by decreasing incidence rate by 24% from 322/100,000 population to 243/100,000 by 2022. Achieve zero TB-affected families facing catastrophic costs by 2022. The objectives of this program are: By 2022, increase TB treatment coverage to from 92% to 95% for DSTB and from 32% to 90% for DRTB.. By 2022, achieve treatment success rate of 92% for DSTB cases and 85% for DRTB cases.. By 2022, reduce catastrophic cost of TB-affected households accessing DOTS facilities to zero.

title.narrative: Coverage / Output indicator for PHL-T-PBSP
Percentage of HIV-positive patients who were screened for TB in HIV care or treatment settings
Percentage of new HIV-positive patients starting IPT during the reporting period
Percentage of TB patients with DST result for at least Rifampicin among the total number of notified (new and retreatment) cases in the same year
Percentage of HIV-positive registered TB patients given anti-retroviral therapy during TB treatment
Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified
Percentage of confirmed MDR-TB cases tested for susceptibility to any fluoroquinolone and any second-line injectable drug
Number of notified TB cases (all forms) contributed by non-national TB program providers – private/non-governmental facilities
Percentage of people living with HIV initiated on ART who are screened for TB in HIV treatment settings

Treatment success rate- all forms: Percentage of TB cases, all forms, bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, successfully treated (cured plus treatment completed) among all TB cases registered for treatment during a specified period, new and relapse cases
Percentage of people living with HIV newly enrolled in HIV care started on TB preventive therapy
Timeliness of facility reporting: Percentage of submitted facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are received on time per the national guidelines

MDR TB-other 1: Number and percentage of laboratories showing at least 95% proficiency for isoniazid and rifampicin drug susceptibility testing among the total number of laboratories that undertake drug susceptibility testing during the reporting period
Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines
Number of notified cases of all forms of TB (i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed), new and relapse cases
Number of TB cases (all forms) notified among prisoners
Percentage of TB patients who had an HIV test result recorded in the TB register
DOTS-other 1: Number and percentage of notified TB cases (all forms) contributed by non-NTP providers- private/ public sector
Number of notified TB cases (all forms) contributed by non-national TB program providers – community referrals
Percentage of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB started on treatment for MDR-TB who were lost to follow up during the first six months of treatment
Percentage of new and relapse TB patients tested using WHO recommended rapid tests at the time of diagnosis
Percentage of confirmed RR/MDR-TB cases tested for resistance to second-line drugs
Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment
Percentage of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on ART during TB treatment
Number of TB cases (all forms) notified among key affected populations/ high risk groups (other than prisoners)
Percentage of bacteriologically confirmed TB cases successfully treated (cured plus completed treatment) among the bacteriologically confirmed TB cases registered during a specified period
Number of people in contact with TB patients who began preventive therapy
Percentage of notified TB cases, all forms, contributed by non-NTP providers - community referrals
Percentage of registered new and relapse TB patients with documented HIV status
Number of notified cases of bacteriologically confirmed TB, new and relapses
Impact indicator for PHL-T-PBSP
TB mortality rate per 100,000 population
RR-TB and/or MDR-TB prevalence among new TB patients: Proportion of new TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB
TB mortality rate
TB incidence rate
TB prevalence rate
TB incidence rate per 100,000 population
Outcome indicator for PHL-T-PBSP
Treatment success rate of all forms of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases

TB treatment coverage: Percentage of new and relapse cases that were notified and treated among the estimated number of incident TB cases in the same year (all form of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed)
Notification of MDR-TB: Notified cases of bacteriologically confirmed, drug resistant TB (RR-TB and/or MDR-TB) as a proportion of the estimated MDR TB cases among the notified TB cases (# & %)
Case notification rate per 100,000 population- bacteriologically-confirmed TB, new and relapse
Case notification rate of all forms of TB per 100,000 population - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
Notification of RR-TB and/or MDR-TB cases – Percentage of notified cases of bacteriologically confirmed, drug resistant RR-TB and/or MDR-TB as a proportion of all estimated RR-TB and/or MDR-TB cases
TB O-Other: Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated
Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated
Treatment success rate - bacteriologically confirmed TB cases
